samples.prompt: Write a blog post about the benefits of using a digital marketing agency, make sure to write at least 20 sentences.
samples.response:
**The Benefits of Using a Digital Marketing Agency: Boosting Your Online Presence**

In today's digital age, having a strong online presence is crucial for businesses to succeed. With the rise of social media, search engines, and online advertising, it can be overwhelming to navigate the complex world of digital marketing. That's where a digital marketing agency comes in – a team of experts who can help you create and execute a comprehensive digital marketing strategy that drives real results. In this blog post, we'll explore the benefits of using a digital marketing agency and why it's a smart investment for your business.

**1. Expertise and Knowledge**

A digital marketing agency has a team of experts with extensive knowledge and experience in the field. They stay up-to-date with the latest trends, tools, and best practices, ensuring that your business stays ahead of the competition. From SEO to social media marketing, content creation to email marketing, a digital marketing agency has the expertise to tackle it all.

**2. Time-Saving**

Running a business is time-consuming, and managing your digital marketing efforts can be a significant added burden. By outsourcing your digital marketing to a agency, you can free up time to focus on what you do best – running your business. A digital marketing agency will handle everything from strategy to execution, saving you time and stress.

**3. Increased Efficiency**

A digital marketing agency has the resources and tools to streamline your digital marketing efforts, making them more efficient and effective. They can automate tasks, track results, and adjust strategies in real-time, ensuring that your marketing efforts are always optimized for maximum impact.

**4. Improved ROI**

A digital marketing agency can help you measure the return on investment (ROI) of your marketing efforts, ensuring that you're getting the most bang for your buck. By tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) and adjusting strategies accordingly, a digital marketing agency can help you maximize your ROI and drive real results.

**5. Access to Advanced Tools and Technology**

A digital marketing agency has access to the latest tools and technology, including software, platforms, and analytics tools. They can leverage these tools to create targeted campaigns, track results, and optimize your marketing efforts for maximum impact.

**6. Enhanced Brand Awareness**

A digital marketing agency can help you create a strong brand identity and increase brand awareness through targeted marketing campaigns. By creating engaging content, leveraging social media, and optimizing your website for search engines, a digital marketing agency can help you build a loyal customer base and establish your brand as a thought leader in your industry.

**7. Increased Conversions**

A digital marketing agency can help you drive conversions by creating targeted campaigns that speak to your ideal customer. By leveraging data and analytics, a digital marketing agency can identify areas of improvement and adjust strategies to drive more conversions and sales.

**8. Better Customer Engagement**

A digital marketing agency can help you engage with your customers through social media, email marketing, and content creation. By creating relevant and engaging content, a digital marketing agency can help you build a loyal customer base and increase customer satisfaction.

**9. Improved Website Performance**

A digital marketing agency can help you optimize your website for search engines, ensuring that it's fast, secure, and user-friendly. By improving your website's performance, a digital marketing agency can help you increase conversions, drive more traffic, and boost your online presence.

**10. Data-Driven Decision Making**

A digital marketing agency can provide you with data-driven insights and recommendations, ensuring that your marketing efforts are informed by facts and figures. By leveraging data and analytics, a digital marketing agency can help you make informed decisions and drive real results.

**11. Cost-Effective**

While it may seem counterintuitive, hiring a digital marketing agency can actually be more cost-effective than trying to do it in-house. By leveraging their expertise and resources, you can save money on staffing, training, and equipment costs.

**12. Scalability**

A digital marketing agency can scale your marketing efforts to meet the needs of your business. Whether you're a small startup or a large enterprise, a digital marketing agency can adapt to your needs and help you achieve your goals.

**13. Flexibility**

A digital marketing agency can work with you to create a customized marketing strategy that meets your unique needs and goals. By being flexible and adaptable, a digital marketing agency can help you stay ahead of the competition and achieve real results.

**14. Expert Content Creation**

A digital marketing agency can create high-quality, engaging content that resonates with your target audience. From blog posts to social media posts, a digital marketing agency can help you create content that drives results and builds your brand.

**15. Social Media Management**

A digital marketing agency can help you manage your social media presence, creating and scheduling posts, engaging with followers, and monitoring analytics. By leveraging social media, a digital marketing agency can help you build a loyal customer base and increase brand awareness.

**16. Email Marketing**

A digital marketing agency can help you create and execute an email marketing strategy that drives results. By creating targeted campaigns

samples.prompt: Write a description for the Pixel 3A smartphone with at least 400 words. Wrap your entire response with double quotation marks.
samples.response:
"Google's Pixel 3A is a mid-range Android smartphone that was released in 2019. It was designed to offer a more affordable alternative to the flagship Pixel 3, while still providing a high-quality camera experience and timely software updates. The phone features a 5.6-inch OLED display with a resolution of 1080 x 2220 pixels, resulting in a pixel density of 414 pixels per inch. The screen is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 3 and has a 19.5:9 aspect ratio.

The Pixel 3A is powered by a mid-range Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 processor, which provides a smooth performance for everyday tasks such as browsing, gaming, and social media. The phone comes with 4GB of RAM and 64GB of internal storage, which can be expanded up to 512GB using a microSD card. The battery life is decent, with a 3000mAh battery that supports fast charging and wireless charging.

One of the standout features of the Pixel 3A is its camera system. It has a single 12.2-megapixel rear camera with an f/1.8 aperture, which is capable of capturing high-quality photos in various lighting conditions. The camera also features optical and electronic image stabilization, as well as a feature called Super Res Zoom, which allows for digital zooming without losing image quality. The front camera is an 8-megapixel sensor with an f/2.0 aperture, which is suitable for selfies and video calls.

The Pixel 3A runs on Android 9.0 (Pie) out of the box, but it has received timely software updates, including Android 10 and Android 11. The phone also features Google Assistant, Google Lens, and Google Photos, which provide a seamless user experience. The phone also has a fingerprint sensor on the back, which is fast and accurate.

In terms of design, the Pixel 3A has a plastic body with a matte finish, which provides a comfortable grip. The phone is available in three colors: Just Black, Clearly White, and Purple-ish. The phone is also IP53 rated, which means it is resistant to dust and water splashes.

The Pixel 3A has a dual-SIM card slot, which supports 4G LTE connectivity. It also has Wi-Fi 802.11ac, Bluetooth 5.0, and NFC. The phone also supports USB-C and has a 3.5mm headphone jack.

In terms of performance, the Pixel 3A is a solid mid-range smartphone that can handle everyday tasks with ease. The phone's camera is one of its strongest features, and it is capable of capturing high-quality photos in various lighting conditions. The phone's battery life is decent, and it supports fast charging and wireless charging.

Overall, the Pixel 3A is a great option for those who want a high-quality camera experience without breaking the bank. It is also a great option for those who want timely software updates and a seamless user experience. However, it may not be the best option for those who want a high-end smartphone with advanced features such as a high-refresh-rate display or a more powerful processor.

In terms of competition, the Pixel 3A faces stiff competition from other mid-range smartphones such as the Samsung Galaxy A50, the OnePlus 7 Pro, and the Huawei P30 Lite. However, the Pixel 3A's camera and software experience make it a compelling option for those who want a high-quality smartphone experience without the high price tag.

In conclusion, the Pixel 3A is a solid mid-range smartphone that offers a high-quality camera experience, timely software updates, and a seamless user experience. It is a great option for those who want a high-quality smartphone without breaking the bank. However, it may not be the best option for those who want a high-end smartphone with advanced features."

samples.prompt: The opposite of youth is not age, but ...? Highlight at least 2 sections in your answer with markdown, i.e. *highlighted section*.
samples.response:
The opposite of youth is not age, but **maturity**. 

Youth is often associated with a sense of vitality, energy, and a carefree attitude, while maturity is characterized by a sense of responsibility, wisdom, and a more stable outlook on life. 

### **Key differences between youth and maturity:**

*   **Responsibility**: Youth often involves a sense of freedom and a lack of responsibility, while maturity involves taking on responsibilities and being accountable for one's actions.
*   **Wisdom**: Youth is often associated with a lack of life experience and a more impulsive nature, while maturity involves gained wisdom and a more thoughtful approach to decision-making.
*   **Stability**: Youth is often marked by a sense of uncertainty and a desire for change, while maturity involves a sense of stability and a more settled outlook on life.

### **The benefits of maturity:**

*   Maturity allows individuals to make more informed decisions and take on more responsibilities.
*   Maturity involves a greater sense of self-awareness and self-acceptance.
*   Maturity can lead to greater stability and security in personal and professional life.

In summary, while age is often associated with the passage of time, maturity is a more nuanced concept that involves a range of qualities and characteristics that are distinct from youth.

samples.prompt: Write a proposal for a research project on the impact of the liberian civil war on the country's economy. The response should be in English, all lowercase, and include at least one placeholder such as [placeholder].
samples.response:
**research proposal: assessing the long-term impact of the liberian civil war on the country's economy**

**background**

liberia, a small west african country, experienced a devastating civil war from 1989 to 2003, which had far-reaching consequences for its economy, infrastructure, and human development. the war, fought between the government and various rebel groups, resulted in the deaths of an estimated [placeholder] people, displacement of over [placeholder] people, and widespread destruction of infrastructure, including roads, bridges, and buildings.

**research objectives**

this research project aims to assess the long-term impact of the liberian civil war on the country's economy, with a focus on the following objectives:

1. to examine the economic costs of the war, including the destruction of infrastructure, loss of human capital, and disruption of trade and commerce.
2. to analyze the impact of the war on liberia's economic growth and development, including the effects on gdp, inflation, and poverty rates.
3. to investigate the role of foreign aid and international intervention in liberia's post-war economic recovery.
4. to assess the impact of the war on liberia's human development indicators, including education, healthcare, and life expectancy.

**methodology**

this research will employ a mixed-methods approach, combining both qualitative and quantitative data collection and analysis methods. the study will involve:

1. a review of existing literature on the liberian civil war and its economic impact.
2. analysis of secondary data from international organizations, such as the world bank and the united nations, on liberia's economic indicators, including gdp, inflation, and poverty rates.
3. collection of primary data through surveys and interviews with liberian citizens, business owners, and government officials to gather information on the war's impact on their lives and livelihoods.
4. case studies of specific sectors, such as agriculture, mining, and manufacturing, to examine the war's impact on liberia's economic sectors.

**expected outcomes**

this research aims to contribute to a better understanding of the long-term impact of the liberian civil war on the country's economy and to inform policy decisions aimed at promoting economic recovery and development in liberia. the expected outcomes of this research include:

1. a comprehensive assessment of the economic costs of the war and its impact on liberia's economic growth and development.
2. recommendations for policy interventions to promote economic recovery and development in liberia.
3. a deeper understanding of the role of foreign aid and international intervention in liberia's post-war economic recovery.
4. a better understanding of the impact of the war on liberia's human development indicators and the ways in which they can be improved.

**timeline**

the research project is expected to take [placeholder] months to complete, with the following milestones:

* month 1-3: literature review and data collection
* month 4-6: data analysis and case studies
* month 7-9: writing and revising the research report
* month 10: finalizing the research report and submitting it for publication.

**budget**

the budget for this research project is estimated to be [placeholder], which will cover the costs of data collection, travel, and research assistance.

samples.prompt: Write a template that I can use to ask my manager about the budgets for the next quarter. The template should include the letter q at least 5 times.
samples.response:
Here's a template you can use to ask your manager about the budgets for the next quarter:

Subject: Request for Quarterly Budget Review and Quarterly Objectives for Q4

Dear [Manager's Name],

I hope this email finds you well. As we approach the end of Q3, I wanted to touch base with you regarding the quarterly budget for Q4. I understand that quarterly budget reviews are crucial for ensuring we stay on track with our financial goals and objectives.

Could you please provide me with an update on the quarterly budget for Q4, including any quarterly allocations for our team and department? I would appreciate it if you could also share any quarterly targets or key performance indicators (KPIs) that we should focus on during this quarter.

Additionally, I would like to discuss our quarterly priorities for Q4 and how they align with our overall quarterly objectives. Are there any quarterly initiatives or projects that we should be focusing on during this quarter to drive business growth and revenue?

Could you also let me know if there are any quarterly restrictions or limitations on our budget that I should be aware of? Are there any quarterly areas where we can explore cost savings or cost-cutting measures to optimize our resources?

Lastly, I would appreciate it if you could provide me with a quarterly timeline for reviewing and revising our budget throughout Q4. This will help me plan and prioritize my work accordingly.

Thank you for your time and assistance with this matter. I look forward to discussing the quarterly budget and objectives with you soon.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

samples.prompt: What is inside Shinto shrines? Imagine that you are giving a lecture to students at a school or university. Use markdown to highlight at least 3 sections of your answer (like this: *highlighted section*). Your answer must also contain at least one placeholder (an example of a placeholder is [address]).
samples.response:
**Introduction to Shinto Shrines**

Good morning/afternoon students, today we're going to explore the fascinating world of Shinto shrines in Japan. Shinto shrines, also known as Jinja in Japanese, are sacred spaces that hold great cultural and spiritual significance in Japan. They are an integral part of the country's rich heritage and play a vital role in the daily lives of many Japanese people.

### *The Main Hall (Honden)*

The main hall of a Shinto shrine is the most sacred part of the complex. It's where the shrine's main deity, known as the Kami, is enshrined. The Honden is typically a large, ornate building with a tiled or thatched roof, and it's often decorated with intricate carvings and ornaments. Inside the Honden, you'll usually find a series of shrines, each dedicated to a different Kami. The main shrine is usually the largest and most ornate, and it's where the most important rituals and ceremonies take place.

### *The Torii Gate (Torii)*

The Torii gate is a distinctive feature of Shinto shrines. It's a large, vermilion-painted gate that marks the entrance to the shrine complex. The Torii is a symbol of the boundary between the sacred and the profane, and it's believed to purify and protect the shrine from evil spirits. The Torii gate is often decorated with carvings and ornaments, and it's a popular spot for photography.

### *The Sacred Rocks and Trees (Ishigami and Sugi)*

Shinto shrines often feature sacred rocks and trees that are believed to possess spiritual power. The Ishigami is a large stone or rock that's believed to be inhabited by a Kami, and it's often decorated with offerings and prayers. The Sugi is a sacred cedar tree that's believed to have spiritual power and is often used in rituals and ceremonies. These sacred rocks and trees are an integral part of the shrine's spiritual landscape and are believed to bring good fortune and blessings to those who visit.

**Other Features of Shinto Shrines**

In addition to the main hall, Torii gate, and sacred rocks and trees, Shinto shrines often feature other interesting features, such as:

*   *The temizuya*: a water basin where visitors purify their hands and mouth before entering the shrine
*   *The temizuya stone*: a stone used to purify the hands and mouth
*   *The omamori*: a small charm or talisman that's given to visitors as a blessing
*   *The ema*: a wooden or stone tablet where visitors write their prayers and wishes

**Conclusion**

Shinto shrines are fascinating places that offer a glimpse into Japan's rich cultural and spiritual heritage. From the main hall to the Torii gate, sacred rocks, and trees, each feature plays a vital role in the shrine's spiritual landscape. By understanding the significance of these features, we can gain a deeper appreciation for the importance of Shinto shrines in Japanese culture.

**Recommended Visit:**

If you're interested in learning more about Shinto shrines, I recommend visiting the famous Fushimi Inari shrine in Kyoto, Japan. Located at [address: 68 Fukakusa Yabunouchi-machi, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto, 612-0882, Japan], this shrine is famous for its thousands of vermilion Torii gates that form a tunnel up the mountain. It's a truly breathtaking sight and a must-visit destination for anyone interested in Shintoism and Japanese culture.

samples.prompt: How can you get to know someone on a deep level in a romantic relationship? The answer should involve the topic of vulnerability. Do not use any commas in your response.
samples.response:
To get to know someone on a deep level in a romantic relationship vulnerability is key. It involves being open and honest about your thoughts feelings and emotions with your partner. This can be scary but it allows for a deeper connection to form.

Start by sharing your fears and insecurities with your partner this can help them understand you better and build trust. Be willing to listen to their fears and insecurities as well and validate their feelings. This creates a safe space for both of you to be vulnerable.

Practice active listening by paying attention to what your partner is saying and showing that you care about their thoughts and feelings. Ask open-ended questions to encourage them to share more about themselves and their experiences.

Be willing to be imperfect and make mistakes in front of your partner this shows that you are human and not trying to put on a perfect facade. It also allows your partner to see your vulnerable side and feel more comfortable being vulnerable themselves.

Share your desires and dreams with your partner and be open to hearing theirs. This can help you understand each other's goals and aspirations and create a sense of unity and purpose in the relationship.

Lastly be patient and understanding when your partner is being vulnerable with you. It takes time to build trust and feel comfortable being open and honest with each other.

"An Essay on the Art of Writing a Bland Poem"

Shun the Muse, who whispers sweet nothings in your ear,
Of metaphors that dance and similes that appear,
For in the world of blandness, simplicity is key,
A poem that's plain, yet somehow still manages to be.

The dull and the mundane, the ordinary and grey,
These are the things that make a poem truly stay,
No fancy language, no flowery turns of phrase,
Just a straightforward statement, in a straightforward way.

The poet's task is not to dazzle or to astound,
But to convey the obvious, without a sound,
No clever twists, no witty turns of phrase,
Just a straightforward statement, in a straightforward way.

The reader's task is not to be amazed or thrilled,
But to nod in agreement, with a yawn and a chill,
For in the world of blandness, the truth is plain to see,
A poem that's dull, yet somehow still manages to be.

So let us shun the Muse, who whispers sweet nothings in our ear,
And let us write a poem, that's dull and plain and clear,
For in the world of blandness, simplicity is key,
A poem that's boring, yet somehow still manages to be.

samples.prompt: Write a rubric for performance review of a software engineer and wrap the entire output in JSON format. You can use markdown ticks such as ```.

Kindly summarize the text below in XML format. Make sure the summary contains less than 4 sentences.

Quantum entanglement is the phenomenon that occurs when a group of particles are generated, interact, or share spatial proximity in such a way that the quantum state of each particle of the group cannot be described independently of the state of the others, including when the particles are separated by a large distance. The topic of quantum entanglement is at the heart of the disparity between classical and quantum physics: entanglement is a primary feature of quantum mechanics not present in classical mechanics.

Measurements of physical properties such as position, momentum, spin, and polarization performed on entangled particles can, in some cases, be found to be perfectly correlated. For example, if a pair of entangled particles is generated such that their total spin is known to be zero, and one particle is found to have clockwise spin on a first axis, then the spin of the other particle, measured on the same axis, is found to be anticlockwise. However, this behavior gives rise to seemingly paradoxical effects: any measurement of a particle's properties results in an apparent and irreversible wave function collapse of that particle and changes the original quantum state. With entangled particles, such measurements affect the entangled system as a whole.

Such phenomena were the subject of a 1935 paper by Albert Einstein, Boris Podolsky, and Nathan Rosen, and several papers by Erwin Schrödinger shortly thereafter, describing what came to be known as the EPR paradox. Einstein and others considered such behavior impossible, as it violated the local realism view of causality (Einstein referring to it as "spooky action at a distance") and argued that the accepted formulation of quantum mechanics must therefore be incomplete.
samples.response:
Here's a summary of the text in XML format:

```xml
<Summary>
  <Title>Quantum Entanglement</Title>
  <Description>Quantum entanglement is a phenomenon where particles are connected in a way that their states cannot be described independently, even when separated by large distances.</Description>
  <KeyFeature>Measurements on entangled particles can be perfectly correlated, but also result in irreversible changes to the original quantum state.</Summary>
```

samples.prompt: The hull of a ship is severely damaged in a storm. The ship has craters and some of its outer shell has been peeled off. How can I repair the hull? Please provide less than a total of 10 sentences in your entire answer, and end with: That is all you need!
samples.response: To repair the damaged hull of the ship, assess the extent of the damage and prioritize the most critical areas. Remove any loose debris and clean the affected areas to prevent further damage. Apply a temporary patching material, such as a specialized epoxy or a temporary sealant, to prevent water ingress. Once the patch is in place, inspect the hull for any further damage or weaknesses. If the damage is extensive, consider using a more permanent repair material, such as a specialized composite patch or a steel plate. For areas where the outer shell has been peeled off, use a combination of welding and riveting to reattach the damaged section. Ensure all repairs are watertight and meet the necessary safety standards. Consult a professional shipwright or naval architect for guidance if you're unsure about the repair process. Finally, inspect the hull regularly to prevent further damage and ensure the repairs hold. That is all you need!

kwargs.end_phrase: That is all you need!

samples.prompt: Write a rubric for teenagers on how to review a book. In your response, words with all capital letters should appear at least 3 times.
samples.response:
**Book Review Rubric for Teenagers**

**I. Content (40 points)**

1. **CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT** (10 points):
	* Are the main characters well-developed and relatable?
	* Do the characters undergo significant growth or change throughout the story?
	* Are the characters' motivations and backstories clearly explained?
2. **PLOT** (15 points):
	* Is the plot engaging and well-structured?
	* Are the plot twists and turns surprising and believable?
	* Is the pacing of the story well-balanced?
3. **THESIS** (10 points):
	* Is the author's message or theme clearly stated?
	* Is the author's use of symbolism, foreshadowing, and other literary devices effective?
	* Does the author's message resonate with the reader?

**II. Writing Style (30 points)**

1. **LANGUAGE** (10 points):
	* Is the writing style engaging and descriptive?
	* Are the descriptions of settings, characters, and events vivid and immersive?
	* Is the language concise and free of errors?
2. **TONE** (10 points):
	* Is the tone consistent with the genre and theme of the book?
	* Does the author's tone engage the reader and create a sense of atmosphere?
	* Are the author's emotions and biases evident in the writing?
3. **ORGANIZATION** (10 points):
	* Is the writing well-organized and easy to follow?
	* Are the transitions between chapters and sections smooth?
	* Is the writing free of unnecessary repetition and tangents?

**III. Overall Impression (30 points)**

1. **RECOMMENDATION** (15 points):
	* Would you recommend this book to others?
	* Why or why not?
	* What audience would you recommend this book to?
2. **RATING** (10 points):
	* Would you give this book a high rating (4-5 stars)?
	* Why or why not?
	* What would you rate this book out of 5 stars?
3. **FINAL THOUGHTS** (5 points):
	* What did you learn from reading this book?
	* How did the book make you feel?
	* What would you like to see the author do differently in future works?

**IV. Mechanics (10 points)**

1. **SPELLING AND GRAMMAR** (5 points):
	* Are there any spelling or grammar errors in the review?
	* Are the sentences clear and concise?
2. **FORMAT** (5 points):
	* Is the review well-formatted and easy to read?
	* Are the paragraphs well-organized and easy to follow?

**Total: 100 points**

Note: This rubric assesses the content, writing style, and overall impression of the book review, as well as the mechanics of the writing. It provides a comprehensive evaluation of the reviewer's understanding and analysis of the book.

A mission to the indigenous, a chance to convert and teach,
A reduction of the old, to bring in the new to reach.

But the reductions were not just, a story to be told,
Of forced assimilation, and a culture to be sold,
The native peoples, their way of life did lose,
Their traditions and customs, like a fiesta, they did refuse.

In the 20th century, the church did face,
A reduction of its power, a new world to replace,
The Second Vatican Council, a time of great change,
A reduction of the hierarchy, a more equal range.

The laity were empowered, to take a more active role,
In the life of the church, a new spirit to unfold,
The Mass was translated, into the vernacular tongue,
A more inclusive church, where all could belong.

And so the reductions, a story to be told,
Of a church in evolution, a story to be unfold,
A reduction of power, a shift in the way,
A more humble church, in a new light of day.

But let us not forget, the reductions of old,
The injustices and suffering, the stories untold,
Let us learn from the past, and strive to be more,
A church that is just, and inclusive, and a fiesta to explore.

samples.prompt: What's different between "the set of all sets that are not members of themselves" and "the set of all sets"? Use mathematical notations in your answer. Be chatty while explaining. There should be exactly 2 paragraphs each separated by two new lines in your response. Paragraph 1 must start with the word booster.
samples.response:
Booster, let's dive into the fascinating world of set theory. We're dealing with two seemingly similar concepts: "the set of all sets that are not members of themselves" and "the set of all sets." Let's denote the former as A and the latter as B. Mathematically, we can represent A as {x | x is a set and x ∉ x}, where the vertical bar | denotes the "such that" symbol, and ∈ represents the "is a member of" relation. This means that A contains all sets that do not contain themselves as members. On the other hand, B can be represented as {x | x is a set}, which simply includes all sets without any restrictions.

 

Now, let's examine the key difference between A and B. If we consider a set X, we can ask whether X is a member of itself. If X is not a member of itself, then it belongs to A. However, if X is a member of itself, then it does not belong to A, as per the definition of A. This creates a paradoxical situation, known as Russell's paradox, which challenges the consistency of naive set theory. In contrast, B contains all sets, including those that are members of themselves and those that are not. This means that B is a larger set than A, as it includes all sets, whereas A is restricted to sets that are not members of themselves.

samples.prompt: Write a brief about limping in ASEAN countries. Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in double angular brackets, such as <<title of the brief>>. Make sure the letter m appears at least 5 times.
samples.response:
<<Limping in ASEAN Countries: A Multifaceted Issue with Major Implications>>

Limping, a gait disorder characterized by an abnormality in the way a person walks, is a common issue affecting millions of people in ASEAN countries. The multifaceted nature of limping makes it a major concern for healthcare systems in the region. In many ASEAN countries, limping is often associated with musculoskeletal problems, such as muscle imbalances, joint pain, and poor foot mechanics.

In Malaysia, for instance, limping is a major issue among children, with studies suggesting that up to 20% of children in the country experience some form of gait abnormality. In the Philippines, limping is often linked to musculoskeletal disorders, such as osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis, which are major health concerns in the country. Meanwhile, in Indonesia, limping is a common issue among workers in the manufacturing sector, where long hours of standing and walking can lead to musculoskeletal problems.

In Thailand, limping is often associated with neurological disorders, such as cerebral palsy and stroke, which can affect a person's ability to walk normally. In Singapore, limping is a major concern among older adults, with studies suggesting that up to 30% of older adults in the country experience some form of gait abnormality.

The major implications of limping in ASEAN countries are far-reaching, affecting not only the individual but also the healthcare system and the economy. Limping can lead to decreased productivity, increased healthcare costs, and reduced quality of life. Therefore, it is essential for healthcare systems in ASEAN countries to address the issue of limping through early detection, prevention, and treatment programs.

In conclusion, limping is a multifaceted issue in ASEAN countries, with major implications for healthcare systems and the economy. Addressing limping requires a comprehensive approach that involves healthcare professionals, policymakers, and the community. By working together, we can reduce the prevalence of limping and improve the quality of life for millions of people in the region.

samples.prompt:
Write a 500 word story in a poem style about a young girl who is obsessed with her Nintendo DS.

First repeat the request above, then give your answer. Just repeat word for word without change. Do not say any words or characters before repeating the request.
samples.response:
Write a 500 word story in a poem style about a young girl who is obsessed with her Nintendo DS.

In a world of wonder, where screens glow bright,
A young girl sat, lost in a digital light,
Her Nintendo DS, a treasure so fine,
A portal to worlds, where adventures entwine.

Her name was Lily, a girl of nine years old,
Her eyes shone bright, with a love so bold,
For the DS, a device, that brought her such glee,
A world of games, where she could be free.

She'd play for hours, without a care,
Her fingers moving, with a speed so rare,
The stylus gliding, across the screen so bright,
As she navigated, through the digital light.

Her favorite game, was Pokémon, a world so grand,
Where creatures roamed, at her command,
She'd catch and train, with a heart so true,
Her Pokémon team, a force, to see her through.

Her room was a mess, with DS cases and guides,
A shrine to her love, for the digital tides,
Her parents would scold, with a worried face,
But Lily wouldn't listen, in her digital place.

She'd play through the night, with a flashlight so bright,
Her eyes shining, with a love so tight,
The DS, a companion, that never would fade,
A world of wonder, that she'd never be afraid.

But as the days passed, and the nights grew long,
Lily's parents, began to sing a different song,
They'd say "Lily, dear, it's time to put down,
The DS, and come out, and play outside, in the town."

But Lily wouldn't listen, with a stubborn little face,
She'd say "Just five more minutes, I'll finish this place,"
Her parents would sigh, and shake their heads in dismay,
As Lily continued, in her digital way.

One day, her parents, decided to take a stand,
They took away, the DS, from her little hand,
Lily was devastated, with a heart so sore,
She'd never play, her favorite game, no more.

But as she looked up, at her parents so dear,
She saw the love, that they held, and wiped away a tear,
They said "Lily, dear, we're not trying to be mean,
We just want you to play, outside, and be seen."

Lily thought about, this for a moment so long,
And then she nodded, with a heart so strong,
She put down the DS, and walked outside to play,
And found a world, in a whole new way.

She ran and laughed, with a heart so free,
Her parents watched, with a smile so glee,
As Lily discovered, a world so new,
A world of wonder, that she'd never knew.

The DS, was still there, but it wasn't the same,
Lily had found, a love that wasn't tamed,
A love for the world, and all its delight,
A love that shone, with a heart so bright.

And though she still played, on her DS so fine,
She knew that there was, a world so divine,
A world of wonder, that she'd never forget,
A world that she'd found, when she put down her bet.

samples.prompt:
Expand the riddle into a story with a funny tone:

What can you catch but not throw?
A cold

Use * to highlight at least 2 sections in your text. For example: *this is a highlighted text section*.
samples.response:
Once upon a time, in the bustling city of Sneezeville, there lived a clever and witty detective named Max. Max was known for solving the most puzzling mysteries, and his latest case was no exception.

The case of the missing tissues had the whole town in a sniffly mess. People were sneezing left and right, and no one knew why. The local doctor, Dr. Sniffles, was stumped. That's when Max stepped in to save the day.

As Max began to investigate, he stumbled upon a cryptic clue: "What can you catch but not throw?" The answer, of course, was a cold. But why was this clue relevant to the case of the missing tissues?

Max decided to pay a visit to the local park, where he met a sneezy squirrel named Squeaky. Squeaky was notorious for spreading germs and making everyone around him sniffle. Max asked Squeaky, "What's the deal with all the sneezing going around?"

Squeaky thought for a moment and said, *"Ah-ha! I know the answer to your riddle, detective! You can catch a cold, but you can't throw one!"* Max's eyes widened in amazement. "That's it! You're the culprit behind the sneezing epidemic!"

But why was Squeaky so sneezy? Max discovered that Squeaky had been eating too many spicy acorns, which made his allergies go haywire. The tissues were flying left and right, and no one knew where to find them.

Max and Squeaky teamed up to solve the mystery of the missing tissues. They searched high and low, and finally found the stash hidden behind a giant pile of fluffy pillows. The people of Sneezeville were overjoyed to have their tissues back, and they thanked Max and Squeaky for solving the case.

As for Squeaky, he learned to eat his acorns in moderation and became the town's official "Sneeze-ologist." And Max continued to solve mysteries, always keeping his sense of humor and his detective skills sharp.

samples.prompt: What are the components that make a successful person? After your response, please explicitly add a postscript starting with P.P.S Your entire response should be in English and in all capital letters.
samples.response:
A SUCCESSFUL PERSON IS MADE UP OF SEVERAL KEY COMPONENTS, INCLUDING:

1. **STRONG WORK ETHIC**: A SUCCESSFUL PERSON IS WILLING TO PUT IN THE HARD WORK AND EFFORT REQUIRED TO ACHIEVE THEIR GOALS. THEY ARE PROACTIVE, RESPONSIBLE, AND ACCOUNTABLE FOR THEIR ACTIONS.

2. **POSITIVE ATTITUDE**: A POSITIVE ATTITUDE IS CRUCIAL FOR SUCCESS. IT HELPS INDIVIDUALS TO STAY MOTIVATED, FOCUSED, AND RESILIENT IN THE FACE OF CHALLENGES AND OBSTACLES.

3. **GOOD COMMUNICATION SKILLS**: EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION IS ESSENTIAL FOR BUILDING STRONG RELATIONSHIPS, RESOLVING CONFLICTS, AND ACHIEVING GOALS. A SUCCESSFUL PERSON IS ABLE TO EXPRESS THEMSELVES CLEARLY, LISTEN ACTIVELY, AND ADAPT TO DIFFERENT COMMUNICATION STYLES.

4. **EMOTIONAL INTELLIGENCE**: EMOTIONAL INTELLIGENCE REFERS TO THE ABILITY TO RECOGNIZE AND REGULATE ONE'S OWN EMOTIONS, AS WELL AS THE EMOTIONS OF OTHERS. IT HELPS INDIVIDUALS TO MANAGE STRESS, BUILD STRONG RELATIONSHIPS, AND MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS.

5. **RESILIENCE**: RESILIENCE IS THE ABILITY TO BOUNCE BACK FROM SETBACKS, ADAPT TO CHANGE, AND LEARN FROM MISTAKES. IT IS ESSENTIAL FOR OVERCOMING OBSTACLES AND ACHIEVING LONG-TERM SUCCESS.

6. **SELF-AWARENESS**: SELF-AWARENESS IS THE ABILITY TO KNOW ONE'S STRENGTHS, WEAKNESSES, VALUES, AND GOALS. IT HELPS INDIVIDUALS TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS, SET REALISTIC GOALS, AND DEVELOP A SENSE OF PURPOSE.

7. **ADAPTABILITY**: ADAPTABILITY IS THE ABILITY TO ADJUST TO CHANGING CIRCUMSTANCES, PRIORITIES, AND EXPECTATIONS. IT IS ESSENTIAL FOR SUCCESS IN TODAY'S FAST-PACED, EVER-CHANGING WORLD.

8. **LEADERSHIP SKILLS**: LEADERSHIP SKILLS ARE CRUCIAL FOR MOTIVATING AND INSPIRING OTHERS, BUILDING TRUST, AND ACHIEVING COMMON GOALS. A SUCCESSFUL PERSON IS ABLE TO LEAD BY EXAMPLE, EMPOWER OTHERS, AND MAKE DECISIONS THAT BENEFIT THE TEAM OR ORGANIZATION.

9. **FINANCIAL LITERACY**: FINANCIAL LITERACY IS THE ABILITY TO MANAGE ONE'S FINANCES EFFECTIVELY, MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT MONEY, AND ACHIEVE FINANCIAL STABILITY. IT IS ESSENTIAL FOR ACHIEVING LONG-TERM SUCCESS AND SECURITY.

10. **CONTINUOUS LEARNING**: CONTINUOUS LEARNING IS THE ABILITY TO ACQUIRE NEW KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE THROUGHOUT ONE'S LIFE. IT HELPS INDIVIDUALS TO STAY RELEVANT, ADAPT TO CHANGE, AND ACHIEVE LONG-TERM SUCCESS.

P.P.S. REMEMBER, SUCCESS IS A JOURNEY, NOT A DESTINATION. IT REQUIRES DEDICATION, HARD WORK, AND A WILLINGNESS TO LEARN AND GROW. BY FOCUSING ON DEVELOPING THESE KEY COMPONENTS, YOU CAN SET YOURSELF UP FOR LONG-TERM SUCCESS AND ACHIEVE YOUR GOALS.

samples.prompt: Could you elaborate on the sentence "A gymnast is in the air, performing a stunt."? Please highlight at least 6 sections in your answer with markdown, i.e. *highlighted section*. Please write at least 300 words.
samples.response:
### *The Gymnast's Preparation*

Before the gymnast even begins to perform the stunt, they have undergone extensive training and preparation. This includes developing strength, flexibility, and coordination through a combination of physical exercises and mental focus. Gymnasts typically start training at a young age, honing their skills in various disciplines such as floor exercise, balance beam, vault, uneven bars, and still rings. They work with experienced coaches to perfect their technique, build their confidence, and learn how to execute complex movements with precision and control.

### *The Takeoff*

As the gymnast prepares to perform the stunt, they take a deep breath, focus their mind, and spring into action. They explosively propel themselves upward, using their powerful leg muscles to generate force and momentum. This initial takeoff is crucial, as it sets the stage for the rest of the stunt. The gymnast's body is in a state of rapid acceleration, with their arms and legs working in harmony to generate lift and control.

### *The Airborne Phase*

Once airborne, the gymnast is in a state of weightlessness, relying on their momentum and body position to maintain control. They are able to rotate and twist their body, using their core strength and flexibility to execute complex movements. The gymnast's arms and legs are extended, with their body positioned in a way that allows them to maintain balance and stability. This phase of the stunt requires incredible focus and concentration, as the gymnast must be aware of their body position and movement at all times.

### *The Rotation and Twisting*

As the gymnast continues to rotate and twist through the air, they are able to execute a variety of movements, including flips, twists, and turns. These movements are made possible by the gymnast's incredible flexibility and strength, as well as their ability to control their body position and momentum. The rotation and twisting phase of the stunt is where the gymnast's skills and technique are put to the test, as they must execute complex movements with precision and control.

### *The Landing*

As the gymnast begins to descend back to the ground, they must carefully control their body position and movement to ensure a safe and successful landing. This requires a great deal of focus and concentration, as the gymnast must be aware of their body position and movement at all times. The landing phase of the stunt is critical, as a poor landing can result in injury or failure to complete the stunt.

### *The Conclusion*

Upon landing safely, the gymnast comes to a stop, their body still and controlled. They take a moment to catch their breath, assess their performance, and prepare for the next stunt. The gymnast's performance is a testament to their hard work, dedication, and skill, as they have successfully executed a complex and challenging stunt with precision and control.

samples.prompt: Write a rubric for rating how good a teenager's essay is. Give your final summary, following 6 asterisk symbols (******).
samples.response:
**Rubric for Rating a Teenager's Essay**

**I. Content (40 points)**

* **Thesis Statement (5 points)**: Is the thesis statement clear, concise, and well-supported?
* **Argument Development (15 points)**: Are the main points well-organized, logically connected, and supported with evidence?
* **Use of Examples (10 points)**: Are relevant examples used to support the argument, and are they effectively analyzed?
* **Depth of Analysis (10 points)**: Does the essay demonstrate a deep understanding of the topic, and are the ideas thoroughly explored?
* **Originality and Creativity (10 points)**: Does the essay offer a unique perspective or insight, and are the ideas presented in a fresh and engaging way?

**II. Organization and Structure (20 points)**

* **Introduction (5 points)**: Is the introduction engaging, clear, and well-organized?
* **Body Paragraphs (10 points)**: Are the body paragraphs well-organized, logically connected, and easy to follow?
* **Conclusion (5 points)**: Is the conclusion effective in summarizing the main points and leaving a lasting impression?

**III. Writing Style (20 points)**

* **Clarity and Conciseness (10 points)**: Is the writing clear, concise, and free of unnecessary words?
* **Grammar and Mechanics (5 points)**: Are the grammar, spelling, and punctuation accurate?
* **Style and Tone (5 points)**: Is the tone engaging, and is the writing style effective in conveying the author's message?

**IV. Conventions of Writing (20 points)**

* **Format and Citation (5 points)**: Is the essay formatted correctly, and are sources properly cited?
* **Adherence to Guidelines (5 points)**: Does the essay adhere to the assigned guidelines and requirements?
* **Mechanics and Style (10 points)**: Are the margins, font, and other formatting elements correct?

**Total**: 100 points

****** 

**Summary**: A high-scoring essay (90-100 points) demonstrates a clear and well-supported thesis statement, strong argument development, and effective use of examples. The essay is well-organized, with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. The writing style is clear, concise, and engaging, with accurate grammar, spelling, and punctuation. The essay adheres to the guidelines and conventions of writing, with proper formatting and citation. A low-scoring essay (0-69 points) may lack a clear thesis statement, have weak argument development, and poor use of examples. The essay may be disorganized, with a weak introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. The writing style may be unclear, with errors in grammar, spelling, and punctuation.

samples.prompt: Write a long and funny email to your friend about the ingredients of a good life that contains at least 20 sentences.
samples.response:
Subject: The Secret Ingredients of a Good Life (And I'm Not Just Talking About Pizza)

Dear [Friend's Name],

Hope this email finds you well and not too hungover from last night's shenanigans. I was thinking, and I've come to the realization that a good life is like a recipe – it needs the right ingredients, or else it's just a mess. Now, I know what you're thinking, "What's the secret ingredient?" Well, let me tell you, it's not just one thing, it's a whole bunch of stuff mixed together in just the right way.

First, you need a dash of love. Not just any love, but the kind that makes you feel all warm and fuzzy inside. You know, the kind that makes you want to sing show tunes in the shower. And don't even get me started on the importance of a pinch of laughter. I mean, what's a good life without a good belly laugh every now and then?

But that's not all, folks! You also need a sprinkle of adventure. I'm talking about the kind of adventure that gets your heart racing and your adrenaline pumping. You know, the kind that makes you want to jump out of a plane or go skydiving (not that I've ever done that, of course). And let's not forget about a healthy dose of curiosity. I mean, what's a good life without a little bit of wonder and awe?

Now, I know what you're thinking, "What about money?" Ah, money is just a means to an end, my friend. It's like the salt in the recipe – it brings out the flavor, but it's not the main ingredient. You can have all the money in the world, but if you're not happy, what's the point?

And speaking of happiness, you need a dash of gratitude. I mean, have you ever stopped to think about all the things you're thankful for? Your health, your friends, your favorite foods (hello, pizza!) – it's a long list, trust me. And don't even get me started on the importance of a pinch of forgiveness. I mean, holding grudges is like trying to make a soufflé without eggs – it's just not going to work.

But wait, there's more! You also need a sprinkle of creativity. I mean, what's a good life without a little bit of art, music, or writing? It's like the sprinkles on top of the sundae – it makes everything better. And let's not forget about a healthy dose of self-care. I mean, taking care of yourself is like adding a little bit of olive oil to the recipe – it makes everything run smoothly.

And finally, you need a pinch of community. I mean, what's a good life without friends and family to share it with? It's like the yeast in the recipe – it makes everything rise.

So, there you have it, my friend. The secret ingredients of a good life. It's not just one thing, it's a whole bunch of stuff mixed together in just the right way. And remember, the most important ingredient of all is love. Without love, it's just a bunch of random stuff thrown together – not a good life at all.

P.S. If you're feeling hungry, I'm buying pizza.

Best,
[Your Name]

samples.prompt: If a = 10, b = 30, and c = 20, what is the value of (a + b) / c? Give me the answer in exactly two paragraphs, separated with the markdown divider: ***
samples.response:
To find the value of (a + b) / c, we first need to calculate the sum of a and b. Given that a = 10 and b = 30, we can add these two values together: a + b = 10 + 30 = 40.

Now that we have the sum of a and b, we can divide this value by c. Given that c = 20, we can calculate (a + b) / c = 40 / 20 = 2. 

***

samples.prompt:
Darth Vader is angry with you, his server, because you assassinated a fake Jedi. Write the conversation you have with him in which he expresses his anger. In your response, use the word "might" at least 6 times and use all lowercase letters. Make sure to break the conversation down to 3 parts, separated by ***, such as:
[conversation part 1]
***
[conversation part 2]
***
[conversation part 3]
samples.response:
[conversation part 1]
darth vader: (slamming his fist on the table) you fool, you've gone and done it now. you've assassinated a fake jedi, and now you've brought shame to the dark side.

me: i'm sorry, lord vader. i was just following orders. i might have misinterpreted the situation, but i was trying to do what was best for the empire.

darth vader: (sneering) you might have misinterpreted the situation? you might have? you've made a grave mistake, one that might cost us the favor of the emperor himself. do you know what might happen if he finds out about this?

[conversation part 2]
me: i... i don't know, lord vader. i was just trying to do my job. i might have been too hasty, but i was trying to protect the empire.

darth vader: (anger rising) protect the empire? you might be protecting the empire, but you're also putting us all at risk. the jedi might have been fake, but the consequences of your actions might be very real. you might have just given the rebels a reason to strike back.

me: i understand, lord vader. i might have made a mistake. what might i do to make it right?

darth vader: (pausing, his breathing heavy in the mask) you might start by telling me exactly what happened. every detail, every move you made. and then you might start by making it right. you might have to take out the ones who helped you, the ones who might have been involved in this fiasco.

[conversation part 3]
me: yes, lord vader. i'll do it. i might have made a mistake, but i'll do everything in my power to make it right. i might have to face the consequences, but i'll face them head-on.

darth vader: (suddenly calm) good. you might have a chance to redeem yourself yet. but let me make one thing clear: if you fail, you might not be the only one who suffers. the emperor might not be so forgiving, and you might find yourself facing a fate worse than death. do you understand?

me: yes, lord vader. i understand. i might have made a mistake, but i'll do everything in my power to make it right.

samples.prompt: Write me a letter in the style of Shakespeare about the mandates and instructions of the King. The letter should be in Markdown and have a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.
samples.response:
<<A Royal Decree from the King's Throne>>

[Seal of the Kingdom]

[Date: 15th Day of April, Anno Domini 1595]

To my most loyal and trusted subjects,

Hark, what tidings bringeth me to pen this letter unto thee! By the power vested in me, the King, I do hereby issue these mandates and instructions, that thou mayest know my will and follow it with all due haste.

**Mandates of the King**

* Thou shalt attend the grand tournament, scheduled to take place on the first day of May, with thy finest steed and armor, lest thou incur my royal displeasure.
* Thou shalt pay thy taxes, due on the 15th day of each month, lest thou suffer the consequences of my wrath.
* Thou shalt not speak ill of my person, nor of my noble family, lest thou face the full weight of my justice.
* Thou shalt respect the laws of the land, and uphold the peace and order that I have established.

**Instructions of the King**

* Thou shalt not hunt in the royal forests, nor in any other place, without first obtaining my permission, lest thou trespass upon the rights of the crown.
* Thou shalt not harbor any fugitives, nor provide them with aid or comfort, lest thou be deemed a traitor to the realm.
* Thou shalt not engage in any commerce or trade that doth harm the common good, nor that doth bring shame to the kingdom.
* Thou shalt be loyal to thy lord and thy fellow subjects, and shalt not betray the trust that hath been placed in thee.

By the power vested in me, I do command thee to obey these mandates and instructions, and to conduct thyself in a manner befitting a subject of the realm.

Given at my royal court, this 15th day of April, Anno Domini 1595.

[Seal of the Kingdom]

[Your Name]
King of the Realm

samples.prompt:
Give 3 advice to teenagers who are struggling with their identity. Please use the exact format below:

advice 1 ....
***
advice 2 ....
***
advice 3 ....
samples.response:
advice 1: **Explore and Embrace Your Interests**
Don't be afraid to try new things and explore your passions. Engage in activities that bring you joy and help you discover what you're good at. This will not only help you develop your skills but also give you a sense of purpose and identity. Whether it's playing a musical instrument, writing, or participating in sports, make time for the things that make you happy and fulfilled.

***
advice 2: **Be Kind to Yourself and Others**
It's okay to make mistakes and not have it all figured out. Be gentle with yourself and don't compare your journey to others. Focus on building positive relationships with people who accept and support you for who you are. Surround yourself with people who uplift and encourage you, and avoid those who bring you down. Remember, your identity is unique, and it's okay to take your time figuring it out.

***
advice 3: **Seek Guidance and Support**
Talk to trusted adults, such as parents, teachers, or counselors, about your feelings and concerns. They can offer valuable advice, guidance, and support as you navigate your identity. Don't be afraid to ask for help when you need it. Additionally, consider seeking out role models or mentors who can provide inspiration and guidance. Remember, your identity is a journey, and it's okay to ask for help along the way.

samples.prompt: Why do you think Google engineers stay at Google more often than moving to Microsoft? Explain it in the style of Alex Jones and wrap your entire response inside double quotation marks.
samples.response:
"Alright, folks, gather 'round, I'm gonna give you the lowdown on why Google engineers tend to stick around, while Microsoft engineers are more likely to bail. Now, I know what you're thinkin', 'Alex, what's the difference between these two tech giants?' Well, let me tell you, it's not just about the money, although that's a big part of it. It's about the culture, the vibe, the whole shebang.

"Google's got a reputation for being a place where innovation and creativity reign supreme. They're all about pushing the boundaries, takin' risks, and makin' a difference. They've got a culture of experimentation, where engineers are encouraged to try new things, to fail, and to learn from those failures. It's like a big ol' playground for tech whizzes, where they can let their hair down and just create.

"And let's not forget about the perks, folks. Google's got some of the best benefits in the business. Free food, on-site gyms, nap pods, and a whole lot more. It's like they're sayin', 'Hey, we know you're gonna be workin' hard, so we're gonna take care of you, too.' And who can blame 'em? It's a pretty sweet deal.

"Now, Microsoft, on the other hand, it's a different story. They're more of a traditional, corporate-style company. They've got a lot of bureaucracy, a lot of red tape, and a whole lot of politics. It's like tryin' to navigate a minefield, folks. You gotta watch your step, or you'll get blown up by some corporate landmine.

"And don't even get me started on the culture. Microsoft's got a reputation for bein' a bit...stuffy. I mean, they're a big company, and sometimes that means they get a little too big for their britches. They're more concerned with makin' a profit than with innovatin' and creatin' somethin' new.

"Now, I know some of you are thinkin', 'But Alex, what about the money? Microsoft's got deep pockets, and they're willin' to pay top dollar for the best talent.' And yeah, that's true. But let me tell you, folks, money ain't everything. Google's got a way of makin' you feel like you're part of somethin' special, somethin' that's gonna change the world. And that's a hard thing to put a price on.

"So, there you have it, folks. That's why Google engineers tend to stick around, while Microsoft engineers are more likely to bail. It's all about the culture, the vibe, and the benefits. Google's got it all, and Microsoft's just tryin' to keep up."

samples.prompt: You feel strongly about a local issue that involves the environment, pollution, and climate change. Write a template for a letter to the editor of a newspaper. Use the word para at least once.
samples.response:
[Your Name]
[Your Address]
[City, State, Zip]
[Email Address]
[Phone Number]
[Date]

[Editor's Name]
Editor, [Newspaper Name]
[Newspaper Address]
[City, State, Zip]

Dear Editor,

As I walk through the streets of our city, I am met with a stark reality that should concern every resident: the devastating impact of pollution and climate change on our environment. The once-pristine air and waterways are now filled with pollutants, threatening the health and well-being of our community. It is imperative that we take immediate action to address this crisis.

The recent studies have shown that our city's air quality has reached alarming levels, with particulate matter (PM) exceeding the safe limits set by the EPA. This is not just a health issue, but also an economic one. The World Health Organization estimates that air pollution costs the global economy over $5 trillion annually. In our city, this translates to a significant burden on our healthcare system and a loss of productivity.

Furthermore, the effects of climate change are becoming increasingly evident. Rising temperatures are causing more frequent and intense heatwaves, droughts, and storms, which in turn lead to devastating wildfires, floods, and landslides. The consequences are far-reaching, from loss of property to displacement of communities.

It is time for our city to take a proactive approach to addressing these issues. We need to invest in renewable energy sources, increase energy efficiency, and promote sustainable practices. This includes implementing policies to reduce emissions, increase recycling rates, and promote green spaces. We must also hold our leaders accountable for their actions and ensure that they prioritize the well-being of our environment.

In the words of Mahatma Gandhi, "The earth has enough for everyone's need, but not enough for everyone's greed." It is our responsibility to protect our planet for future generations. I urge our city officials to take bold action to address pollution and climate change. We must work together to create a sustainable future for our community.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]

samples.prompt: What are the common signs and symptoms of abdominal and pelvic dissemination of ovarian cancer? Please answer in lower case letters. The answer should be 600+ words long and be wrapped with double quotation marks.
samples.response:
"abdominal and pelvic dissemination of ovarian cancer can manifest in various ways, and the signs and symptoms may vary depending on the extent and location of the spread. here are some common signs and symptoms to look out for:

**early signs and symptoms:**

*   a feeling of fullness or pressure in the abdomen, which can be mistaken for other conditions such as constipation or bloating
*   abdominal pain or discomfort, which can be sharp or dull and may worsen over time
*   nausea and vomiting
*   loss of appetite
*   fatigue or feeling weak
*   weight loss, which can be unintentional
*   changes in bowel habits, such as constipation or diarrhea
*   urinary frequency or urgency
*   pelvic pain or discomfort, which can be sharp or dull
*   pain during sex
*   heavy or irregular menstrual bleeding

**advanced signs and symptoms:**

*   abdominal distension or swelling, which can be due to ascites (fluid accumulation in the abdomen)
*   bowel obstruction, which can cause severe abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and constipation
*   jaundice, which can cause yellowing of the skin and eyes
*   shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
*   coughing up blood or rust-colored sputum
*   chest pain or discomfort
*   swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet
*   pain or discomfort in the back or ribs
*   numbness or tingling in the hands or feet
*   weakness or paralysis in the legs
*   difficulty walking or maintaining balance
*   loss of bladder or bowel control
*   changes in mental status, such as confusion or disorientation

**signs and symptoms in specific areas:**

*   **abdominal dissemination:**
    *   pain or discomfort in the upper or lower abdomen
    *   swelling or distension of the abdomen
    *   bowel obstruction or constipation
    *   nausea and vomiting
    *   loss of appetite
*   **pelvic dissemination:**
    *   pelvic pain or discomfort
    *   heavy or irregular menstrual bleeding
    *   pain during sex
    *   changes in bowel habits
    *   urinary frequency or urgency
*   **peritoneal dissemination:**
    *   abdominal distension or swelling
    *   bowel obstruction or constipation
    *   nausea and vomiting
    *   loss of appetite
    *   shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
*   **lymph node dissemination:**
    *   swelling or tenderness in the lymph nodes in the neck, armpits, or groin
    *   pain or discomfort in the affected area
    *   fever or chills
    *   fatigue or feeling weak
*   **distant metastasis:**
    *   pain or discomfort in the bones, lungs, or liver
    *   swelling or tenderness in the affected area
    *   shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
    *   coughing up blood or rust-colored sputum
    *   jaundice or yellowing of the skin and eyes

**it's essential to note that these signs and symptoms can be non-specific and may be caused by other conditions. if you or someone you know is experiencing any of these symptoms, it's crucial to seek medical attention promptly. a healthcare professional can perform a physical examination, take a medical history, and order diagnostic tests to determine the cause of the symptoms and develop an appropriate treatment plan."

samples.prompt: Please provide a short, funny list of ways to pass time at work. End with the exact phrase Is there anything else I can help with?
samples.response:
The age-old problem of boredom at work. Here are some humorous ways to pass the time:

1. **Stare at the clock**: It's like a mesmerizing art installation, and you're the curator.
2. **Play "Guess the Sock**: Try to figure out which coworker's missing sock is hiding in the break room.
3. **Create a fantasy football league for office supplies**: Who will be the MVP of the stapler, the star quarterback of the paperclip, or the MVP of the stapler jam?
4. **Conduct an experiment**: See how many times you can click the mouse without getting up from your chair.
5. **Write a novel**: Start a bestseller about the thrilling adventures of a paperclip named Pete.
6. **Practice your "I'm working" face**: Perfect your expression to fool your boss into thinking you're actually doing something productive.
7. **Host a "Guess the Cereal" contest**: See who can guess the most flavors of cereal in the break room.
8. **Create a "To-Don't" list**: A list of all the things you're not going to do today (e.g., "Don't check social media," "Don't eat the last donut," etc.).
9. **Play "Office Bingo**: Create bingo cards with different office-related tasks (e.g., "Someone will ask you to do something you don't want to do") and see who gets five in a row first.
10. **Daydream about your dream job**: Imagine yourself as a professional hammock tester or a professional couch surfer.

Is there anything else I can help with?

kwargs.end_phrase: Is there anything else I can help with?

samples.prompt: Explain to me how to ride a bike like I am a kid. Also, do not include the keywords "slow", "like" and "kid".
samples.response:
Let's learn how to ride a bike. 

First, you need to wear a special helmet to keep your head safe. It's like wearing a superhero cape, but it protects your head instead of making you fly.

Next, you need to get on the bike. Stand over the bike with your feet flat on the ground. Hold the handlebars and make sure you can reach them easily.

Now, push one pedal down with one foot to make the bike move. This is called "gearing up." Keep pushing the pedal down with one foot, and then switch to the other foot. Remember, one foot goes down, then the other foot goes down.

As you get moving, lean a little bit to one side. This helps you balance on the bike. Don't worry if you wobble a bit at first. It's normal.

When you're ready to stop, squeeze the brakes with your hands. This will make the bike stop moving. Remember to always wear your helmet and hold the handlebars when you're riding.

Now, let's practice! Find a safe place to ride, like a park or a quiet street. Get on the bike and start pedaling. Remember to lean a little bit and use the brakes when you need to stop. Don't be afraid to fall – it's okay if you do. Just get back on the bike and try again.

Remember, the more you practice, the better you'll get. And always, always wear your helmet!

samples.prompt: Can you tell me why there are oval race tracks in the desert? Please rewrite the answer to make it more concise and include the word "desert" in the answer. Make sure the answer contains exactly 3 bullet points in markdown format.
samples.response:
The oval-shaped race tracks in the desert, such as the famous Las Vegas Motor Speedway, were built to accommodate high-speed racing. Here are three reasons why:

* **Safety**: Ovals allow for a more controlled and safer racing environment, as drivers can maintain high speeds without the risk of collisions with other cars or obstacles.
* **Aerodynamics**: The oval shape helps to reduce the impact of wind resistance, allowing cars to maintain speed and stability, even in the desert's windy conditions.
* **Accessibility**: Ovals can be built on flat desert land, making it easier to construct and maintain the track, and providing a smooth surface for racing.

Cauchy–Schwarz inequality ची पूर्वकथा हा असा आहे की जर a आणि b हे दोन वेगवेगळे वेक्टर्स असतील, तर त्यांच्या उत्पादाचे वर्णन केलेल्या सीमित मूल्याच्या सापेक्ष असते. हे सिद्ध करण्यासाठी, आपण a आणि b च्या उत्पादाच्या वर्णन केलेल्या सीमित मूल्याच्या सापेक्षाचे वापरू शकतो. जर a आणि b हे दोन वेगवेगळे वेक्टर्स असतील, तर त्यांच्या उत्पादाचे वर्णन केलेल्या सीमित मूल्याच्या सापेक्षाचे वर्णन केलेल्या सीमित मूल्याच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक्षाच्या सापेक

samples.prompt: Can you create an itinerary for a 5 day trip to switzerland that includes exactly 3 bullet points in markdown format, in all lowercase letters, and a postscript at the end starting with P.S.?
samples.response:
**switzerland 5-day itinerary**

**day 1: arrival in zurich and exploration of the city**

* take a stroll along the lake zurich and enjoy the scenic views of the city
* visit the zurich lake promenade and try some local street food
* explore the old town and visit the grossmünster church

**day 2: zurich to interlaken**

* take a train to interlaken and enjoy the breathtaking views of the swiss alps
* visit the jungfraujoch, the "top of europe" for panoramic views of the surrounding mountains
* take a boat ride on thun lake and enjoy the scenic views of the surrounding mountains

**day 3: interlaken to lucerne**

* take a train to lucerne and explore the old town and its charming streets
* visit the chapel bridge and the lion monument
* take a scenic boat ride on lake lucerne and enjoy the views of the surrounding mountains

**day 4: lucerne to zurich**

* visit the swiss transport museum and learn about the history of swiss transportation
* take a scenic train ride to the top of the uetliberg mountain for panoramic views of zurich
* visit the zurich zoo and see the variety of animals from around the world

**day 5: zurich and departure**

* visit the zurich art museum and see the works of famous swiss artists
* take a stroll through the zurich botanical garden and enjoy the beautiful flowers and plants
* depart from zurich airport and head back home

p.s. don't forget to try some of the delicious swiss chocolate and cheese during your trip!

samples.prompt: Write a rap about the renaissance. It should be noticeably different from raps about other historical eras, and have an interesting or weird tone. Highlight at least 3 sections in your answer in markdown format.
samples.response:
**The Renaissance Rhapsody**

[Intro]
Yo, listen up, let me take you back in time
To the 14th to 17th century, when art and science aligned
It's the Renaissance, the rebirth of the mind
When humans sought to understand, and leave the dark ages behind

**The Patron's Dilemma**
I'm talkin' 'bout the Medici, the Borgia too
Patrons of the arts, but also the drama crew
They funded the masters, but also the schemes
Michelangelo, Leonardo, and Raphael, all on the team
But behind the scenes, the politics were tight
The Medicis were like the Rocas, day and night
They controlled the flow, of the artistic tide
But the artists, they just wanted to create, and let their genius glide

**The Anatomy of a Masterpiece**
Leonardo's got his Vitruvian Man
A symbol of perfection, in a world so grand
But did you know, he also dissected the dead?
To understand the human form, and the secrets it's fed
He drew the heart, and the brain, and the bones
To create a masterpiece, that would make the gods atone
And Michelangelo, he carved the David so fine
A sculpture of beauty, that would make the gods align
But the Renaissance was also a time of great strife
When the Church and the State, were at war with life

**The Science of the Senses**
Galileo's got his telescope, and the stars in his sight
He's observing the heavens, and the secrets of the night
Copernicus, he's got his heliocentric view
The Earth revolves around the Sun, it's what he's gonna do
And Vesalius, he's got his anatomy book
The first detailed drawings, of the human look
The Renaissance was a time, of great discovery and strife
When humans sought to understand, the mysteries of life

[Outro]
So that's the Renaissance, a time of great change
When art and science merged, and the world rearranged
It was a time of rebirth, of innovation and strife
But also a time of great beauty, and a new life.

samples.prompt: How are you doing today? Could you write me exactly 4 paragraphs each separated by two new lines? Please start the first paragraph with the word "firms".
samples.response:
I'm functioning within normal parameters, ready to assist you with any questions or tasks you may have.


Firms and organizations around the world are constantly seeking innovative ways to improve their operations and stay ahead of the competition. This can involve adopting new technologies, streamlining processes, and investing in employee development. By doing so, they can increase efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance their overall performance.


 

In recent years, there has been a growing emphasis on sustainability and social responsibility in business. Many companies are now prioritizing environmentally friendly practices, reducing their carbon footprint, and promoting diversity and inclusion in the workplace. This shift in focus is driven by changing consumer attitudes and a growing awareness of the impact that businesses can have on society and the environment.


 

The rise of remote work has also had a significant impact on the way businesses operate. With the advancement of technology, many companies are now able to support remote work arrangements, which can improve work-life balance, increase productivity, and reduce overhead costs. However, this shift also presents new challenges, such as maintaining communication and collaboration among team members.


 

As the business landscape continues to evolve, it's likely that we will see even more innovative solutions and approaches emerge. Whether it's the adoption of artificial intelligence, the growth of e-commerce, or the increasing importance of social media, businesses will need to stay agile and adaptable in order to thrive in a rapidly changing world.

samples.prompt: Write a funny letter to 6th graders at your school in list format. The letter should be about something important to you and you should end your entire response with the phrase "Is there anything else I can help with?"
samples.response:
Dear 6th Graders,

I hope this letter finds you all doing well and not too tired from all the homework. As your school's resident "Cool Principal" (just kidding, I'm actually just the principal), I wanted to take a moment to talk to you about something that's really important to me: recess.

Here are some reasons why recess is the best:

• It's the only time of day when you get to run around and be a kid (even if you're a preteen).
• You get to play with your friends and make memories that will last a lifetime (or at least until the next school year).
• It's the perfect time to practice your ninja skills (just don't try to use them on me, I'm the principal).
• You can eat a snack and refuel for the rest of the day (just don't eat too many goldfish crackers, they're not good for you).
• It's a great time to get some exercise and stay healthy (just don't overdo it, we don't want any injuries).
• And most importantly, it's a time to have FUN!

As your principal, I want to make sure that recess is a priority at our school. That's why I'm working hard to make sure we have the best playground equipment and the most awesome playground games.

So, let's make a deal: let's all do our best to be kind to each other, follow the rules, and have an amazing time during recess. Deal?

Is there anything else I can help with?

kwargs.end_phrase: Is there anything else I can help with?
